text: pLKO.1-puro lentiviral vectors carrying short hairpin RNAs ( shRNA ) specific for human and mouse <extra_id_0> cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were used in these studies .

Because the human and mouse <extra_id_0> cebpb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 3 ' untranslated regions are not identical , these species - specific shRNAs can not knockdown expression of endogenous <extra_id_0> C/EBP-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> when used on cells of the other species ; therefore we used the human CEBPB shRNA as a control in these experiments as in [ 38 ] .

To produce lentiviral particles , HEK-293T cells were transfected with a mixture of plasmids : each shRNA expression plasmid ( 1 microg ) , pCMV-deltaR8.2dvpr packaging plasmid ( 0.75 microg ) , and pCMV-VSV-G envelope plasmid ( 0.25 microg ) using Lipofectamine 2000 reagent ( Invitrogen ) .
The lentiviral supernatant was collected 48 hrs after transfection , cleared by centrifugation at 2 , 000 g for 10 mins and passed through a 0.45 microm filter .
The target cells were treated with the lentiviral supernatant and 8 microg / ml Polybrene ( American Bioanalytical ) for 24 hrs .
The lentiviral supernatant was replaced with fresh growth media and incubated further for 72 hrs to allow for effective gene knockdown .
